definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Forget about level surfaces, forget about standing back, and just pick up your quadrotor and throw it.
sentences.chinese: 忘記水平面，忘記站在後面，就拿起你的旋翼扔。

sentences.english: The origins both renal ostia from the aorta were at the same level in 11 cases.
sentences.chinese: 兩腎動脈開口位於腹主動脈同一水平面11例。

sentences.english: The depth of a boat in the water, measured from the waterline to the lowest section of the keel.
sentences.chinese: 帆船進入水的深度，從水平面到龍骨最低處測量。

sentences.english: Water always finds its own level.
sentences.chinese: 鉛垂線總是垂直於水平面的。

sentences.english: The moveable horizontal surface of the empennage used for pitch trim.
sentences.chinese: 飛機尾翼的可動水平面，用來控制俯仰配平。

sentences.english: The plumb line is always perpendicular with the horizontal plane.
sentences.chinese: 鉛垂線總是垂直於水平面。

sentences.english: It's going to move in the horizontal plane.
sentences.chinese: 它將會朝着水平面得複習移動。

sentences.english: He dropped down to the level of the younger gull.
sentences.chinese: 他下降到年輕海鷗的水平面。

sentences.english: The plumbline is always perpendicular to the horizontal plane.
sentences.chinese: 鉛垂線總是垂直於水平面的。

sentences.english: The graph of a function one is just a horizontal plane at height one.
sentences.chinese: 函數1的圖像就是高度爲1的水平面。

sentences.english: Ears - Folded level with top of head, with forward edge close to cheek.
sentences.chinese: 耳朵的摺痕位於頭頂的水平面，前側邊緣貼近面頰。

sentences.english: Scientists say the water level is dropping about three feet a year.
sentences.chinese: 科學家說，其水平面每年下降達三英尺多。

sentences.english: At the rear, the wall wraps around at first-floor level to shelter the garden.
sentences.chinese: 在房屋後部，牆壁圍繞到二樓水平面以遮蔽花園。

definition: vertical/to erect/to set upright/vertical stroke in Chinese characters/young servant (old)
dip/angle of dip (inclination of a geological plane down from horizontal)/tilt (inclination of ship from vertical)
